page.title: 15LAND USE NEAR WIRKSWORTH
page.content: THE MAJOR LAND USE IS FARMING. THE FORESTRY COMMISSION OWN 3 AREAS OF WOODLAND. THERE ARE OTHER DECIDUOUS WOODS TOO. THE NATIONAL TRUST OWN THE LAND AT ALPORT HEIGHT WITH MAGNIFICENT VIEWS FOR MILES AROUND. A TUNNEL IS BEING BUILT BY THE SEVERN TRENT WATER AUTHORITY TO LINK THE CARSINGTON RESERVOIR AND THE RIVER DERWENT NEAR AMBERGATE. THE MAIN ENTRANCE TO ONE OF THE SECTIONS IS NEAR THE SOUTHERN EDGE OF WIRKSWORTH. AT ALPORT HEIGHT THE POLICE HAVE A SERIES OF RADIO MASTS. A MINERAL RAILWAY RUNS FROM WIRKSWORTH TO DUFFIELD.
